text: Kentoku (建徳) was a Japanese era name (年号, nengō, lit. year name) of the Southern Court during the Nanboku-chō period after Shōhei and before Bunchū. The period started in July 1370 and ended in April 1372.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Kentoku" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 510.
